Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant qualifies as a Convention refugee or person in need of protection based on conscientious objection and Kurdish ethnicity
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant did not declare conscientious objection or belong to an organization
Evidence_Type: Evidence showed no additional risk for Kurdish draft evaders beyond standard penalties
Legal_Provision: IRPA - refusal to serve in compulsory military service does not constitute persecution unless linked to specific grounds
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of declaration of objection and absence of organizational ties; no evidence of heightened risk due to ethnicity
Application_Error: Failure to establish link between military avoidance and protected grounds under IRPA
Legal_Standard: Requirement of persecution linked to race, religion, nationality, membership in a particular social group, or political opinion
Application_Factor: Non-violent beliefs not formally declared or affiliated
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed; applicant not recognized as a refugee or person in need of protection
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division's decision was reasonable
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on refugee eligibility and conscientious objection
Cause_of_Refusal: No reasonable basis for claim under refugee law
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence linking avoidance of military service to protected grounds
Credibility_Issues: Applicantâ€™s claim of conscientious objection lacked corroboration or formal declaration
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim based on conscientious objection and ethnic background
